import Tabs from "@theme/Tabs";
import TabItem from "@theme/TabItem";
import CodeSnippet from "@theme/CodeSnippet";

> Elements with ARIA roles must use a valid, non-abstract ARIA role
>
> User impact: **Serious**

This rule supports the following configuration:

<Tabs
  groupId="config-language"
  defaultValue="toml"
  values={[
    { label: "TOML", value: "toml" },
    { label: "Shell", value: "shell" },
  ]}
>
  <TabItem value="toml">
    <CodeSnippet
      snippet={`# All role attributes must be valid.\naria_role = true\n# All role attributes must match the provided list\naria_role = [ "search", "presentation", "alert",]`}
      annotations={[]}
      lang="toml"
    />
  </TabItem>
  <TabItem value="shell">
    <CodeSnippet
      snippet={`# All role attributes must be valid.\ncurlylint --rule 'aria_role: true' .\n# All role attributes must match the provided list\ncurlylint --rule 'aria_role: ["search", "presentation", "alert"]' .`}
      annotations={[]}
      lang="shell"
    />
  </TabItem>
</Tabs>

## Success

<Tabs
  groupId="config-language"
  defaultValue="toml"
  values={[
    { label: "TOML", value: "toml" },
    { label: "Shell", value: "shell" },
  ]}
>
  <TabItem value="toml">
    <CodeSnippet
      snippet={`<!-- Good: Valid role provided -->\n<!-- aria_role = true -->\n<form role="search"></form>\n<!-- Good: Role matches provided options -->\n<!-- aria_role = [ "table", "search", "presentation",] -->\n<form role="search"></form>`}
      annotations={[]}
      lang="html"
    />
  </TabItem>
  <TabItem value="shell">
    <CodeSnippet
      snippet={`<!-- Good: Valid role provided -->\n<!-- curlylint --rule 'aria_role: true' . -->\n<form role="search"></form>\n<!-- Good: Role matches provided options -->\n<!-- curlylint --rule 'aria_role: ["table", "search", "presentation"]' . -->\n<form role="search"></form>`}
      annotations={[]}
      lang="html"
    />
  </TabItem>
</Tabs>
